benchmark_details.name: Bambara Language Dataset for Sentiment Analysis
benchmark_details.overview: We present the first common-crawl-based Bambara dialectal dataset dedicated for Sentiment Analysis, available freely for Natural Language Processing research purposes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to provide a dataset for sentiment analysis in the Bambara language and to support further research activities in African languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is not balanced, including a majority of positive sentences compared to negative and neutral ones.

data.source: Common-crawl-based dataset collected and manually annotated by two Malian native speakers.
data.annotation: Sentiment annotation was processed manually by native speakers, with sentences annotated as positive (1), negative (-1), or neutral (0).

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of different models applied to the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by higher values of accuracy and F1 scores; SVM was found to perform best overall.
methodology.baseline_results: SVM achieved 73% accuracy on Bambara V1 dataset and 71% accuracy on Bambara V2 dataset.
methodology.validation: The datasets were split to form train and test datasets in specific ratios (80:20 for ML, 90:10 for DL).
